study_details.exposure: whole-body exposure to RASS, an environmental tobacco smoke surrogate, at 6 and 12 g total particulate matter/l for 12 h/d, 6 d/week,12 months
study_details.comparison: another group of rats was head-only exposed at 12 g/l for 7 h/d

findings.urinary_analysis: No sign of pulmonary inflammation was seen
findings.inflammation: slight increase in oxidative DNA damage (8-hydroxy-deoxyguanosine) in the nasal respiratory epithelium
findings.dna_damage: slight increase in oxidative DNA damage (8-hydroxy-deoxyguanosine) in the nasal respiratory epithelium
findings.histopathological_changes: minimal to moderate reserve cell hyperplasia and squamous metaplasia and hyperplasia in the larynx at the base of epiglottis; and slight reserve cell hyperplasia in the bronchi
